keyTakeAways: A man named Billy Joe Cagle, a 49-year-old convicted felon from Cartersville, Georgia, was arrested at Hartsfield-Jackson Atlanta International Airport after a family alerted authorities that he had streamed on social media a plan to 'shoot it up' at the airport.
Cagle was found in possession of an AR-15 assault rifle and 27 rounds of ammunition in a Chevrolet pickup truck parked directly outside the airport terminal.
He had previously posted on Facebook claiming to be schizophrenic and taking medication, and a friend reported concerns due to his social media posts.
Cagle is charged with making terroristic threats, criminal attempt to commit aggravated assault, possession of a firearm during the commission of a felony, and possession of a firearm by a felon.
The arrest was credited to a tip from family members, which led to the successful prevention of a potential mass shooting at one of the world’s busiest airports.
The incident underscores the growing role of social media in revealing potential threats and the importance of community vigilance in public safety.
Law enforcement and federal authorities are investigating how Cagle obtained the firearm, which authorities say he was not legally permitted to possess.

summaryOfNewsArticle: A 49-year-old convicted felon from Cartersville, Georgia, Billy Joe Cagle, was arrested at Hartsfield-Jackson Atlanta International Airport after his family alerted authorities that he had streamed on social media a plan to 'shoot it up' at the airport. Police found an AR-15 rifle and 27 rounds of ammunition in his Chevrolet pickup truck parked outside the terminal. Cagle, who had previously claimed to be schizophrenic and on medication, is charged with terroristic threats, criminal attempt to commit aggravated assault, and illegal firearm possession. The arrest was credited to a tip from family members, who recognized the danger and acted to prevent a potential mass shooting. Officials, including Police Chief Darin Schierbaum, Mayor Andre Dickens, and Homeland Security Secretary Kristi Noem, emphasized the success of early warning and community vigilance. The incident highlights the role of social media in revealing threats and the importance of mental health awareness and law enforcement coordination.
title: Man Arrested at Atlanta Airport After Social Media Threat of Mass Shooting
